Articles.Content:
> 
> Is this beautiful mod dead?

When I see people asking if a mod is dead I often recall the words of the great master Yoda......

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yIlyqh5-gvU?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

"Death is a natural part of life. Rejoice for those around you who transform into the Force. Mourn them do not. Miss them do not. Attachment leads to jealously. The shadow of greed, that is."

> 
> Is this beautiful mod dead?

And dead is not accurate anyway - it works fine since it was developed and released for 1.0.4...

> 
> Is toolbar required?

For the balloon, yes. (That's a limitation of Hooligan Labs -- it's on the devs' radar, but not fixed yet.)

> 
> For the balloon, yes. (That's a limitation of Hooligan Labs -- it's on the devs' radar, but not fixed yet.)

Primary hold up is the lack of a coder.

> 
> When I see people asking if a mod is dead I often recall the words of the great master Yoda......
> 
> 
> 
> <iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yIlyqh5-gvU?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>
> 
> "Death is a natural part of life. Rejoice for those around you who transform into the Force. Mourn them do not. Miss them do not. Attachment leads to jealously. The shadow of greed, that is."

I feel like I'm going to see this on every inactive mod now ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

In general, mods aren't dead, just go inactive for a long time (KW rocketry, for instance, once seemed to disappear and then in 0.90 or so BOOM they're back with incredible things)
Any news on how this works in 1.0.5?
Any one still have this mod? Or is it gone forever.

> 
> 
> 13 hours ago, Imca said:
> 
> 
> Any one still have this mod? Or is it gone forever.
> 

You can still download it from [Curse](https://kerbal.curseforge.com/projects/discreet-parts)

It appears to have an MIT license meaning it could be adopted

**Edited <time datetime="2018-01-03T18:46:33Z" title="01/03/2018 06:46  PM" data-short="6 yr">January 3, 2018</time> by FreeThinker**

The main problem seems to be Animate2Variable.dll....

If some one knows how to recompile it....

>

If I were to do this, I'd use the Retractable Lifting Surface mod.

Any idea where the HLAirships.dll comes from?

But the lack of colliders in the wings is an issue, I won't release it if that is still a problem.

Also, I really don't want to have to decompile that dll, I've emailed the author about the source

**Edited <time datetime="2018-01-06T02:46:03Z" title="01/06/2018 02:46  AM" data-short="6 yr">January 6, 2018</time> by linuxgurugamer**

> 
> 
> 6 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:
> 
> 
> If I were to do this, I'd use the Retractable Lifting Surface mod.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Any idea where the HLAirships.dll comes from?
> 

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed5315336599" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/49443-airships-in-13-hooliganlabs-mods/&do=embed" style="height:214px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

Am working on your plugin Retractable Lifting Surface at the time, I did a quick update forgot the name of it so I used the other but am having alittle problem with the setting up of the cfg for it have posted in that thread

EDIT- And need some one that know a little about the Firespitter plugin has they are now 1 of  engines has thrust even if the engine is off or not deployed

The license for HooliganLabs is ARR, which means that the dll can't be included with the mod.

not a big deal, just something to keep in mind, and, it's not guaranteed to work with 1.3.1.  I took a quick look at the code, and didn't see anything which would be an issue, but until it's recompiled for 1.3.1, I'd probably stay away from it
